title: AI Assistant Operations
purpose: Intelligent analysis, drafting assistance, and case insights powered by AI to accelerate legal work

workflowContext.dataFlow: AI Assistant reads case context from all linked data, processes user queries, and generates contextual responses, drafts, or recommendations

capabilities.description: Generate concise case summaries for various audiences
examplePrompts: Summarize this case for a client update email
Give me a 2-paragraph brief of the case status
What are the key facts and current status?
capabilities.outputFormat: Structured text with key points highlighted

capabilities.description: Find relevant precedents and legal principles
examplePrompts: What are relevant precedents for ITC denial under Section 17(5)?
Find cases where penalty was waived due to procedural lapses
What is the limitation period for filing appeal against this order?
Draft a reply to this demand notice
Prepare arguments for the upcoming hearing
Draft an email to client explaining the order

capabilities.description: Analyze case strengths, weaknesses, and options
examplePrompts: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this case?
Should we appeal or accept this order?
What are the risks of contesting vs settling?
What are the upcoming deadlines for this case?
How is the reply due date calculated?
What happens if we miss the appeal deadline?

capabilities.description: Extract and analyze information from documents
examplePrompts: What are the key issues raised in this notice?
Compare this order with the previous one
Extract all dates and amounts from this document

principles.good: Draft a reply addressing the ITC reversal demand of Rs. 45 lakhs under Section 17(5)(h)
principles.why: Specific prompts get precise, actionable responses

principles.good: Given the recent HC ruling in ABC vs State that Section 17(5) requires actual use test, analyze our position
principles.why: Context helps AI tailor response to your specific situation

principles.good: Provide the analysis in bullet points with citations
Make it more formal and add legal citations

promptTemplates.template: Draft a client update email explaining [specific development] in simple terms. Include next steps and timeline.
For the hearing on [date] before [forum], prepare: 1) Key arguments, 2) Anticipated counter-arguments, 3) Supporting precedents
Analyze the order dated [date]. Highlight: 1) Key findings, 2) Compliance requirements, 3) Appeal options with deadlines
For this case with demand of [amount], analyze: 1) Litigation risk, 2) Settlement options, 3) Recommended approach with reasoning

quickActions.bestPractice: Use for quick catch-up on cases you haven't reviewed recently

quickActions.outcome: Generates reply draft based on notice and case data
quickActions.bestPractice: Always review and edit AI drafts before using

quickActions.outcome: Returns relevant case citations with summaries
quickActions.bestPractice: Verify citations independently before citing in court

quickActions.trigger: Upload or select document → Ask question about it
quickActions.outcome: AI reads document and answers contextually
quickActions.bestPractice: Break complex documents into specific questions

commonWorkflows.name: Quick Case Briefing
steps: Open AI Assistant from case context
Click 'Summarize Case' or type 'Give me a quick summary'
Copy relevant parts for emails or meetings

commonWorkflows.name: Draft Legal Document
steps: Open AI Assistant from case context
Ask for modifications ('Make it more formal', 'Add more detail on X')
Copy to document editor for final formatting

commonWorkflows.name: Prepare for Hearing
steps: Open AI Assistant with case and upcoming hearing
Ask 'Help me prepare for the hearing on [date]'

Partner.focus: Strategic analysis, complex case insights, high-level summaries
bestPrompts: Analyze litigation risk for this case
What's the best outcome we can realistically achieve?
Compare this with similar cases we've handled

Advocate.focus: Drafting assistance, precedent research, document analysis
bestPrompts: Draft a reply to this notice
What are the key points in this order?

Manager.focus: Team briefings, case summaries for review, workload insights
bestPrompts: Summarize the status of all cases with hearings this week
What are the priority items across my team's cases?
Extract all dates from this document
What is the demand amount in this notice?
List the documents mentioned in this order

warnings.title: Always Verify AI Output
warnings.message: AI-generated content should always be reviewed by a legal professional before use. Verify all citations, calculations, and legal statements.

warnings.title: AI Does Not Replace Legal Judgment
warnings.message: AI provides assistance and suggestions, not legal advice. Final decisions must be made by qualified professionals.

warnings.title: Context-Limited
warnings.message: AI only has access to data within the current case and linked documents. It cannot access external databases or real-time information.

warnings.title: Iterate for Better Results
warnings.message: If the first response isn't quite right, refine your prompt or ask follow-up questions. AI improves with specific feedback.

limitations.description: Cannot access current court listings, live case status from government portals, or news
limitations.workaround: Provide relevant external information in your prompt if needed

limitations.description: May not have knowledge of very recent legal developments or amendments
limitations.workaround: Specify recent changes in your prompt if asking about new law

limitations.description: Can only analyze and generate text; cannot create tasks, schedule hearings, or send emails
limitations.workaround: Copy AI recommendations and execute through appropriate modules

limitations.description: Works within one case at a time; cannot compare across multiple cases automatically
limitations.workaround: Provide comparison data manually in prompt

troubleshooting.solution: Be more specific, ensure case context is loaded, break into smaller questions
Always verify citations independently; AI may generate plausible but incorrect references
Specify desired length: 'In 3 bullet points' or 'Give a detailed 2-page analysis'
